abstract: Google, under pressure from regulators, will offer people the option to keep names and locations of their Wi-Fi routers out of a company database.
snippet: Google, under pressure from regulators, will offer people the option to keep names and locations of their Wi-Fi routers out of a company database.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Google, under pressure from privacy regulators in the Netherlands, said Tuesday that it had agreed to give people around the world the option of keeping the names and locations of their home or business Wi-Fi routers out of a company database.

headline.main: Google Allows Wi-Fi Owners to Opt Out of Database
headline.print_headline: Google Agrees to Allow Owners of Wi-Fi Routers to Opt Out of Database
